posts.post_content:
You can get any bringer out on the third turn.  
  
First turn play a land  
2nd turn play land and rampant growth and get a land  
third turn play a 4th land and play [Channel the suns](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Channel the suns)
posts.html:
You can get any bringer out on the third turn.

First turn play a land
2nd turn play land and rampant growth and get a land
third turn play a 4th land and play Channel the suns

Posted By: Karrod (9/27/2009 9:17:52 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Mike, I would believe brun was pulling a joke on 'a dawn' being 'her name is Dawn'.  
  
Or maybe I'm reading that wrong.  
  
And what does Mr. Jobs have to do with this?  
  
That's a moose for sure. I wish All the Bringers had come back for Scars of Mirrodin.  
This one especially. It would be far to epic to yell 'The moose is loose' as each [Darksteel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel) card came back into play.  
And with the Ramp with Myr or the use of enough [Mox Opals](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Opals) and [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise) you can salvage those Myr back in for a second wind.  
  
Then there is [Throne of Geth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Throne of Geth) on [Core Prowler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Core Prowler). Proliferate like mad.  
  
Definitely 5/5, even if Dawn missed her lime light.
posts.html:

That's a moose for sure. I wish All the Bringers had come back for Scars of Mirrodin.
This one especially. It would be far to epic to yell 'The moose is loose' as each Darksteel card came back into play.
And with the Ramp with Myr or the use of enough Mox Opals and Birds of Paradise you can salvage those Myr back in for a second wind.

posts.post_content:
Karrod, how about
  
Turn 1: land, [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise)   
Turn 2: land, tap for [Pentad Prism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pentad Prism), play another Bird
  
Turn 3: Two lands = Mana of 1 color, let's say Green ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol), two birds=![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol), Pentad Prism=![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)   
And that's even in *Mirrodin* Standard.
  
You could even get a turn 1 out, but that's very unrealistic, as you would need either 4 different Mox or Lotus of the Alpha type and a land for the last color, or all 5 in Mox or 4 and a Lotus, 3 and 2 Lotus, etc.
posts.html:
